ul.li: ON - Commands EPU to run regardless of failure conditions
NORM - Armed for automatic operation
OFF - Terminates EPU operation in flight, except in the case of main or standby electrical generator failures
Illuminates when the EPU turbine speed is within the proper range
Illuminates AIR/HYDRAZINE when the EPU is commanding hydrazine for operation
Illuminates AIR when the EPU is providing standby electrical power
MAIN PWR - Connects external power or the main generators to the electrical system (If no a/c power is available, connects aircraft battery to the battery buses)
BATT - Connects aircraft battery to the battery buses
OFF - Disconnects aircraft battery from the battery buses (canopy operation is available after engine shutdown)
Resets main and standby generators, over-current protection units, and ELEC SYS caution lights
TO FLCS - Indicates battery bus power going to one or more of the four FLCS electrical branches
FLCS RLY - Indicates that voltage on one or more of the FLCS branches is inadequate or zero
FAIL - Indicates aircraft battery failure
FLCS PMG - None of the FLCS branches are receiving power
MAIN GEN - External or main generator power is not connected to one or both essential a/c buses and has likely failed
STBY GEN - Standby generator power is not available
EPU GEN - Indicates the EPU has been commanded on but is not providing power to both emergency a/c buses
EPU PMG - Indicates the EPU has been commanded on but EPU generator power is not available to all branches of the FLCS

area.title: Electrical Systems - Controls and Indicators Panel
Jet Fuel Start (JFS) Switch and JFS RUN Light

ul.li: START1 - Vents one of the hydraulic JFS accumulators to the hydraulic start motor
OFF - Normal switch position. The JFS can be shut down at anytime by selecting OFF. The switch will return to OFF automatically during a normal ground start at 50 percent rpm.
START2 - Vents both accumulators to the hydraulic start motor
RUN light - Illuminates when the JFS engine is running
PRI - Primary engine computer operation (Guarded position)
SEC - Secondary engine computer operation (Unguarded position)
AB RESET - Inoperative
NORM - Normal (de-energized) position
ENG DATA - Used to record engine data for an 8 second period
Inoperative in the current Block F-16C

area.title: Engine and Jet Start Control Panel

ul.li: Selects video source to be recorded
ON - Continuous ACMI recording
AUTO - 30 seconds of ACMI recording at trigger detent or weapon pickle
OFF - Cancel recording
Indicates system has power

area.title: Cockpit TV Sensor (CTVS) and AVTR Lights
area.impl: Both lights illuminate, but AVTR doesn't actually record MFD/HUD video

ul.li: Lights are illuminated Amber in AUTO mode and Green in ON mode
CTVS - Indicates that the AVTR is recording video w/out HUD
AVTR - Indicates AVTR is recording MFD or HUD video

area.title: Airborne Video Tape Recorder Control Panel
ECM Power
area.impl: Only OPR and OFF are working

ul.li: OPR - Power is provided to the ECM pod (if loaded)
STBY - ECM is in Standby mode
OFF - No power is provided
The remaining switches, buttons and indicators on this panel are classified and/or non-functional
Left for off; right for volume
OFF - Disables squelch
SQL - Enables squelch
GD - Tunes to the guard frequency
Secure Voice (KY-58) radio volume control
TF volume control
IR missile seeker head volume control
Threat Warning System volume control
Power/volume control of the intercom system (internal audio systems, crew chief, boom operator, etc.)
Power/Volume control for audible TACAN station ID signal
Power/Volume control for audible ILS receiver tone
HOT MIC - Activate communications to crew chief/boom operator
OFF - Deactivates HOT MIC and CIPHER functions
CIPHER - Limit UHF and VHF traffic to secure voice only
OFF - Backup UHF is not powered
MAIN - Radio operates on selected frequency
BOTH - Radio operates on selected frequency and receives only on the GUARD frequency
ADF - Automatic Direction Finder

area.title: UHF Backup Volume Knob
area.impl: Balances AI volume with IVC volume

ul.li: Set volume for UHF radio in BACKUP mode
MANUAL - Freq set by manual input
PRESET - Freq set by Channel Knob
GUARD - Transmit/receive on the guard freq
Enables/Disables squelch function
When pressed and released gives audible beep to verify entries

area.title: UHF Backup Radio Manual Frequency Knobs

ul.li: Allows manual input of UHF radio frequencies including:
A32 Anti Jam Knob; A=Anti Jam mode
Tests for INOP display digits
Push to display mode radio is presently in (e.g. VEROP, M-WORD)

area.title: UHF Backup Radio Channel Knob & Display

ul.li: Permits clickable selection of 20 preset UHF frequencies
NORM - Normal operation of AOA and g limiters
OVRD - Overrides the AOA/g limiter and enables unrestricted control of the horizontal tails to allow pitch commands in order to recover from a deep stall
